content:
ObjectStateEntry Class

In this Article

Represents either an entity, entity stub or relationship.

Syntax

Declaration

public abstract class ObjectStateEntry : System.Data.Objects.DataClasses.IEntityChangeTracker

Inheritance Hierarchy

  • System.Object
  • ObjectStateEntry

Inherited Members

Equals(Object)
,
Equals(Object,Object)
,
GetHashCode()
,
GetType()
,
MemberwiseClone()
,
ReferenceEquals(Object,Object)
,
ToString()

Remarks

No content here will be updated; please do not add material here.

Properties summary

CurrentValues

Gets the current property values of the object or relationship associated with this ObjectStateEntry.
Entity

Gets the entity object.
EntityKey

Gets or sets the entity key.
EntitySet

Gets the EntitySetBase for the object or relationship.
IsRelationship

Gets a value that indicates whether the ObjectStateEntry represents a relationship.
ObjectStateManager

Gets the ObjectStateManager for the ObjectStateEntry.
OriginalValues

Gets the read-only version of original values of the object or relationship.
RelationshipManager

Gets the RelationshipManager instance for the object represented by entry.
State

Gets or sets the state of the ObjectStateEntry.

Methods summary

AcceptChanges()

Accepts the current values as original values.
ApplyCurrentValues(Object)

Sets the current values of the entry to match the property values of a supplied object.
ApplyOriginalValues(Object)

Sets the original values of the entry to match the property values of a supplied object.
ChangeState(EntityState)

Changes state of the entry to the specified EntityState value.
Delete()

Marks an entity as deleted.
GetModifiedProperties()

Returns the names of an objectâ€™s properties that have changed since the last time stem.Data.Objects.ObjectContext.SaveChanges* was called.
GetUpdatableOriginalValues()

Gets the updatable version of original values of the object associated with this ObjectStateEntry.
IsPropertyChanged(String)

Uses DetectChanges to determine whether or not the current value of the property with the given name is different from its original value. Note that this may be different from the property being marked as modified since a property which has not changed can still be marked as modified.
RejectPropertyChanges(String)

Rejects any changes made to the property with the given name since the property was last loaded, attached, saved, or changes were accepted. The orginal value of the property is stored and the property will no longer be marked as modified.
SetModified()

Sets the state of the object or relationship to modify.
SetModifiedProperty(String)

Marks the specified property as modified.

Explicit Interface Implementations summary

IEntityChangeTracker.EntityComplexMemberChanged(String,Object,String)

Notifies the state manager that a complex property has changed.
IEntityChangeTracker.EntityComplexMemberChanging(String,Object,String)

Notifies the state manager that a complex property has a pending change.
IEntityChangeTracker.EntityMemberChanged(String)

Notifies the state manager that a property has changed.
IEntityChangeTracker.EntityMemberChanging(String)

Notifies the state manager that a property has a pending change.
IEntityChangeTracker.EntityState

Gets the EntityState for the ObjectStateEntry.

Properties

  • CurrentValues

    Gets the current property values of the object or relationship associated with this ObjectStateEntry.

    public abstract System.Data.Objects.CurrentValueRecord CurrentValues { get; }

    Property Value

    • CurrentValueRecord

      A CurrentValueRecord that contains the current values of the object or relationship associated with this ObjectStateEntry.

  • Entity

    Gets the entity object.

    public abstract object Entity { get; }

    Property Value

    • System.Object

      The entity object.

  • EntityKey

    Gets or sets the entity key.

    public abstract System.Data.EntityKey EntityKey { get; }

    Property Value

    • EntityKey

      The entity key.

  • EntitySet

    Gets the EntitySetBase for the object or relationship.

    public System.Data.Metadata.Edm.EntitySetBase EntitySet { get; }

    Property Value

    • EntitySetBase

      The EntitySetBase for the object or relationship.

  • IsRelationship

    Gets a value that indicates whether the ObjectStateEntry represents a relationship.

    public abstract bool IsRelationship { get; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      true if the ObjectStateEntry represents a relationship; otherwise, false.

  • ObjectStateManager

    Gets the ObjectStateManager for the ObjectStateEntry.

    public System.Data.Objects.ObjectStateManager ObjectStateManager { get; }

    Property Value

    • ObjectStateManager

      The ObjectStateManager for the ObjectStateEntry.

  • OriginalValues

    Gets the read-only version of original values of the object or relationship.

    public abstract System.Data.Common.DbDataRecord OriginalValues { get; }

    Property Value

    • DbDataRecord

      The read-only version of original values of the relationship set entry or entity.

  • RelationshipManager

    Gets the RelationshipManager instance for the object represented by entry.

    public abstract System.Data.Objects.DataClasses.RelationshipManager RelationshipManager { get; }

    Property Value

    • RelationshipManager

      The RelationshipManager object.

  • State

    Gets or sets the state of the ObjectStateEntry.

    public System.Data.EntityState State { get; }

    Property Value

    • EntityState

      The state of the ObjectStateEntry.

Methods

  • AcceptChanges()

    Accepts the current values as original values.

    public abstract void AcceptChanges ();
  • ApplyCurrentValues(Object)

    Sets the current values of the entry to match the property values of a supplied object.

    public abstract void ApplyCurrentValues (object currentEntity);

    Parameters

    • currentEntity
      System.Object

      The detached object that has updated values to apply to the object. currentEntity can also be the objectâ€™s entity key.

  • ApplyOriginalValues(Object)

    Sets the original values of the entry to match the property values of a supplied object.

    public abstract void ApplyOriginalValues (object originalEntity);

    Parameters

    • originalEntity
      System.Object

      The detached object that has original values to apply to the object. originalEntity can also be the objectâ€™s entity key.

  • ChangeState(EntityState)

    Changes state of the entry to the specified EntityState value.

    public abstract void ChangeState (System.Data.EntityState state);

    Parameters

    • state
      EntityState

      The EntityState value to set for the stem.Data.Objects.ObjectStateEntry.State* property of the entry.

  • Delete()

    Marks an entity as deleted.

    public abstract void Delete ();
  • GetModifiedProperties()

    Returns the names of an objectâ€™s properties that have changed since the last time stem.Data.Objects.ObjectContext.SaveChanges* was called.

    public abstract System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable<string> GetModifiedProperties ();

    Returns

    • IEnumerable<String>

      An stem.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable`1 collection of names as string.

  • GetUpdatableOriginalValues()

    Gets the updatable version of original values of the object associated with this ObjectStateEntry.

    public abstract System.Data.Objects.OriginalValueRecord GetUpdatableOriginalValues ();

    Returns

    • OriginalValueRecord

      The updatable original values of object data.

  • IsPropertyChanged(String)

    Uses DetectChanges to determine whether or not the current value of the property with the given name is different from its original value. Note that this may be different from the property being marked as modified since a property which has not changed can still be marked as modified.

    public abstract bool IsPropertyChanged (string propertyName);

    Parameters

    • propertyName
      String

      The name of the property.

    Returns

    • Boolean

      true if the property has changed; otherwise, false.

    Remarks

    For complex properties, a new instance of the complex object which has all the same property values as the original instance is not considered to be different by this method.

  • RejectPropertyChanges(String)

    Rejects any changes made to the property with the given name since the property was last loaded, attached, saved, or changes were accepted. The orginal value of the property is stored and the property will no longer be marked as modified.

    public abstract void RejectPropertyChanges (string propertyName);

    Parameters

    • propertyName
      String

      The name of the property to change.

    Remarks

    If the result is that no properties of the entity are marked as modified, then the entity will be marked as Unchanged. Changes to properties can only rejected for entities that are in the Modified or Unchanged state. Calling this method for entities in other states (Added, Deleted, or Detached) will result in an exception being thrown. Rejecting changes to properties of an Unchanged entity or unchanged properties of a Modifed is a no-op.

  • SetModified()

    Sets the state of the object or relationship to modify.

    public abstract void SetModified ();
  • SetModifiedProperty(String)

    Marks the specified property as modified.

    public abstract void SetModifiedProperty (string propertyName);

    Parameters

    • propertyName
      String

      The name of the property.

Explicit Interface Implementations

  • IEntityChangeTracker.EntityComplexMemberChanged(String,Object,String)

    Notifies the state manager that a complex property has changed.

    void IEntityChangeTracker.EntityComplexMemberChanged (string entityMemberName, object complexObject, string complexObjectMemberName);

    Parameters

    • entityMemberName
      String

      The name of the top-level object property that is changing.

    • complexObject
      System.Object

      The complex object that contains the property that is changing.

    • complexObjectMemberName
      String

      The name of the property on the complex object that is changing.

  • IEntityChangeTracker.EntityComplexMemberChanging(String,Object,String)

    Notifies the state manager that a complex property has a pending change.

    void IEntityChangeTracker.EntityComplexMemberChanging (string entityMemberName, object complexObject, string complexObjectMemberName);

    Parameters

    • entityMemberName
      String

      The name of the complex property.

    • complexObject
      System.Object

      The complex object that contains the property that is changing.

    • complexObjectMemberName
      String

      The name of the property on the complex object that is changing.

  • IEntityChangeTracker.EntityMemberChanged(String)

    Notifies the state manager that a property has changed.

    void IEntityChangeTracker.EntityMemberChanged (string entityMemberName);

    Parameters

    • entityMemberName
      String

      The name of the entity property that has changed.

  • IEntityChangeTracker.EntityMemberChanging(String)

    Notifies the state manager that a property has a pending change.

    void IEntityChangeTracker.EntityMemberChanging (string entityMemberName);

    Parameters

    • entityMemberName
      String

      The name of the entity property that is changing.

  • IEntityChangeTracker.EntityState

    Gets the EntityState for the ObjectStateEntry.

    System.Data.EntityState System.Data.Objects.DataClasses.IEntityChangeTracker.EntityState { get; }

    Returns

    • EntityState

      The EntityState for the ObjectStateEntry.
